The '''Brook of Glass''' was a stream near [[Tavrobel]] in [[Tol Eressëa]], according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in one of the outlines for the continuation of ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.<ref name="Brook">{{LT2|VI}}, outline '''8''', p. 287</ref>

It was close to the [[Heath of the Sky-roof]], a site of a [[Battle of the Heath of the Sky-roof|great battle]] during the [[Faring Forth]], when the [[Elves]] of Tol Eressëa attempted to rescue their [[Ilkorindi|kin]] living in the [[Great Lands]].<ref name="Brook"/> In the aftermath of the battle, [[Eriol]] the mariner stole away from the war-torn heath, and fled down the valley of the river - however, the waters of the stream were "fouled with the war of men and grime of strife".<ref name="Brook"/>

== Inspiration ==
According to [[John Garth]], the Brook of Glass might have been inspired by the Sher Brook near [[wikipedia:Cannock Chase|Cannock Chase]], not far from the village of [[wikipedia:Great Haywood|Great Haywood]], which served as the main inspiration behind the town of Tavrobel.<ref>[[John Garth]], ''[[Tolkien and the Great War]]'', "Epilogue. 'A new light'", p. 273</ref>
